fileHeader.contentDescription:
This example shows many features in Beremiz:
1. How to implement python extensions. 2. How to implement basic C extension. 3. How to use C code in IEC POUs. 4. How to call C functions from python code. 5. How to avoid race conditions between IEC, C and python code. 6. How to convert betweet different IEC types.

content.xhtml:p: This part of the example test that, despite of 2T period clock stimulating TRIG pin of pyth_eval blocks, blocks keep executing one after the other, in respect of execution order.
You will be ready to use beremiz with C and Python when you will understand why "FromInput" is equal to 75. Happy hacking!
Sleep here is bad. It blocks other py_eval instances. Whith a wxGlade GUI, GUI freeze for a second.
Prints FBID to stdout of PLC runtime. FBID is a unique reference to py_eval instance.
Simple_C_Call is declared in C_File "1.x:c_code". See python ctypes manual for details on typing.
Fast clock, at least faster that sleep(1). See what happens when python takes time to answer : PLC continues.
Shows global variables access from resource configuration (res_pytest) and from project's configuration.
Here is shown how to convert values between different types (BCD, DT, TOD, STRING and others) using standard functions.
Example of usage of user-defined function.
Shows access variable defined in python extension.

Incorrect BCD number is not converted to UINT.
151 (16#97) is good BCD number , but 154 (16#9A) is not.
Try this out and look at value of Test_BCD_CONVERTED variable.

This example shows many features in Beremiz:
1. How to implement python extensions. 2. How to implement basic C extension. 3. How to use C code in IEC POUs. 4. How to call C functions from python code. 5. How to avoid race conditions between IEC, C and python code. 6. How to convert betweet different IEC types.
